DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records the reason the subject presented to the clinic.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._(GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines._the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:(GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.

Property.preferredDefinition: the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The value that describes the explanation or the reason the subject visited the GI clinic.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.: Benign or malignant abnormal growth in the colon or rectum.

Concepts.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the colon or rectum.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.  Colorectal adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information. : A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive test that detects the presence of hidden (occult) blood in the stool. This is commonly performed to screen for colon cancer.

Concepts.definition: A noninvasive test that detects the presence of hidden (occult) blood in the stool. This is commonly performed to screen for colon cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.: A systematic examination or assessment.

Concepts.definition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Elevated; raised or increased.: Carcinoembryonic antigen. A substance that is sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood of people with certain cancers.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

A cancer-specific antigen associated with both tumors and the developing fetus. The main use of this antigen is as a tumor marker, especially with respect to intestinal cancers. Production of the antigen ceases shortly before birth, but may reappear in people who develop certain types of cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.:the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
